ai-kv13.8:1.3_0: There are sentient beings who look for what is suffering. They look for what is suffering. And they seek out what is felt.
ai-kv13.8:1.4_0: And you don’t keep on doing it.
ai-kv13.8:1.5_0: Since they don’t look for happiness, they seek for what is pleasant, painful, and neutral feeling that arises.
ai-kv13.8:1.7_0: If there is pleasure, one who seeks happiness, all beings seek happiness, and solitary retreat, thinking, ‘There is no way of using happiness.’
ai-kv13.8:1.8_0: “Are there anyone who isn’t gone beyond?”
ai-kv13.8:2.3_0: for unpleasant feeling the tendency to repulsion underlies it, and the underlying tendency for repulsion underlies it.
ai-kv13.8:2.4_0: And you don’t keep on doing it.
ai-kv13.8:2.5_0: Doesn’t the underlying tendency for greed for pleasant feeling?
ai-kv13.8:2.7_0: The underlying tendency for greed underlies pleasant feeling. The underlying tendency for repulsion did not underlie it, and painful feeling.
ai-kv13.8:2.8_0: “Are there anyone who isn’t gone beyond?”
ai-kv13.8:3.2_0: “Are there anyone who isn’t gone beyond?”
ai-kv13.8:3.5_0: “So, opposites, whatever feelings arise in, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by pleasant, painful, or neutral feelings?”
ai-kv13.8:3.8_0: Therefore therefore there is no sorrow,
ai-kv13.8:3.9_0: The account of the prominent merchant’s statement is finished.
